meanings.definition: The extent of the area or subject matter that something deals with or to which it is relevant.
meanings.sent1: The scope of the project includes designing the website and creating content.
meanings.sent2: She was given the scope to lead the team and make decisions.
meanings.sent3: The detective's scope of investigation led him to uncover the hidden clues.
meanings.sent4: Her scope of knowledge reached far beyond what was expected.
meanings.sent5: The vast scope of the universe is both fascinating and overwhelming.

meanings.definition: The opportunity or possibility to do or deal with something.
meanings.sent1: He saw the scope to start his own business and took the chance.
meanings.sent2: The scope for growth in this company is immense.
meanings.sent3: The magician's scope to perform his tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The scope for adventure in the unknown forest was thrilling.
meanings.sent5: She seized the scope to learn a new skill and excelled.

meanings.definition: The range of one's perceptions, thoughts, or actions.
meanings.sent1: His scope of understanding the complex topic was impressive.
meanings.sent2: The scope of her emotions was evident in her expressive artwork.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's scope of jokes kept the audience laughing all night.
meanings.sent4: The scope of his influence extended to people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent5: Her scope of creativity knew no bounds when it came to painting.
